title: Azir vs Lissandra
body: Who do you guys think is the stronger mid laner? please help {{champion:268}} vs {{champion:127}}

replies.body: whoever plays better. a good azir would know how to q and w at the right place and when to e but a good lizandra would precast her q to re q out of his ult.
who you think would be the better champion casue im getting 1 of them

Azir 

He is one of the strongest and most scary champs when mastered.
Azir is a much harder carry but provides little crowd control and has a generous skill threshold, lissandra is fairly easy to play and quite a safe pick in lower elos

My opinions are:

{{champion:127}} 
* a huge amount of cc which allows her to chase or escape 
* her w helps her already strong kiting potential, making it easy even for ppl that can't kite reliably
* her e is great for mobility, mind games and damage
* her passive is a great help
her ult damages, heals (self-cast), slows and what not. great for last minute saves and/or peeling and cc-ing the entire enemy team, when grouped
**PLAY HER IF:**
* You don't mind planning and poking for a bit of time early game. She lacks the dmg early game to jump on opponents
* You can rely on your teammates/Your team comp can benefit of someone that can engage and cc
* You are good at warding. Despite her e (on long cooldown), Liss is quite squishy at the start and needs a few core items before she can deal with ganks and multiple opponents at the same time.

{{champion:268}} 
* great burst damage and attack speed which allow for interesting itemization
* a versatile set of combo with different effects
* if placed at the right time, his turrets can grant you kills (and if not placed well, often grants you gold)
* once mastered, and practiced with positioning, he's a beast
* His ult can have devastating changes on a team fight.
**PLAY HIM IF:**
* You don't mind spending some (lots of ) time practicing
* You can manage attacks and movement (an immobile azir is not a happy azir)
* Your team can use some heavy AP busting.

Personally, my playstyle aligns better with {{champion:127}}  and I find her useful in a range of positions, able to come back from a bad start or still being significant for her team regardless of performance. Once strong, she remains strong and her tankiness is a nice +. She is indubitably better in lanes that don't risk ganks and when you have a choice to start playing her passively (top lane). Otherwise, her early low damage but high utility make her a decent support. In mid lane, she exposes her weaknesses quite a lot (less good vs ganks and vs long-distance mages).
On the other hand, {{champion:268}} has great zoning potential but is somewhat more squishy. His abilities and damage make him way better than Liss on mid lane and once mastered, he can do quite a bunch of cool tricks that can puzzle even good opponents. 

TL;DR: Different playstyles, {{champion:268}} better for mid overall. {{champion:127}} still great but exposes her natural weaknesses on a lane where ganks are more prevalent and poking is against other ranged champs.
